alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:47PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cowlitz County through 415 PM PDT... At 346 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Silver Lake, or 10 miles northeast of Kelso, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kelso, Castle Rock, Longview, Kalama, West Side Highway, Longview Heights, Ostrander, Carrolls, Lexington and Rose Valley. This includes the following highways in Washington... Interstate 5 between mile markers 33 and 49. State Route 4 near mile marker 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades
